metadata.titel_preek: A Sound Word For A New Year

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The faithful believer must endure a period of historical and personal 'abomination' (crisis) by waiting and trying, until God's final vindication and rest are achieved.

tekstueel_bewijs: It is our job to try on and pray on.
We must rise and try again.
Thou shalt rest, and stand in thy lot at the end of the days.

zender.identificatie: God (as the one who sets the 'lot' and the timeline)
tekstueel_bewijs: God's great hour is sure to strike.
God still holds the reins of the world.
God has a place for each of us.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Subject who must perform the 'waiting'.

helper.identificatie: Christ / The Word of the Lord
tekstueel_bewijs: And we have Christ to go with us to the end.
He says, 'I will be with you.'
helper.rol_van_god: God is primarily the Sender/Goal; Christ is the Helper accompanying the Subject.

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Abomination of Desolation' (Historical chaos, political corruption, personal despair)
tekstueel_bewijs: The screaming hurricanes of evil blow down the temples of our faith.
The fist of evil may seem to hold the world in a remorseless grip.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as a 'world gone mad' and 'passing tyranny' that threatens the very core of faith.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The quest for national/social renewal (1955-1965) which failed.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Nation / Civil Rights Movement
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The failure of the social program (Program 2) necessitates the spiritual endurance program (Program 1).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Christ → The Hearer ← The Abomination of Desolation
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Hearer → Waiting/Trying → The End of Days

voorbeelden_god_subject: God shall wipe away all tears.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must rise and try again.
You weary one, try on, pray on, work on.
One braves the future by deciding.

voorbeelden: We must rise and try again.
The Christian person wants to know.
We seem in the grip of worldwide forces which we do not understand.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the obligation to endure (Devoir) despite a lack of power (Pouvoir), framing faith as a 'hard business' of the will.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (the grim 1975) to ~S2 (Waiting) toward the hope of S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is eschatological; the tension is held by the human act of 'trying' until God intervenes.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the 'abomination' is treated as a crushing reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon ends with a strong theocentric appeal for Christ to 'come and save,' the middle section is heavily moralistic, defining faith as the human effort to 'try on' and 'hold on.'

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Lord, I've tried, Lord, I've really tried.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Come, Lord Jesus, and deliver us.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Daniel and the Hasidim are used as models of 'deciding' to brave the future.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how God preserved Daniel in the lion's den despite Daniel's powerlessness.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Exhaustion; the hearer is told they are already tired, then given more work (trying/waiting).
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism; God's 'hour' strikes only for those who 'try on'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon successfully links historical anxiety to biblical text, but the transition from 'trying' (human subject) to 'Christ saving' (divine subject) is abrupt.
spanning_punten: The 'Lord I've tried' song vs. 'Come Lord Jesus and save us else we perish'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God still holds the reins... superrules.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not mentioned as the source of 'Pouvoir' (power).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is an 'abomination' that desolates the soul.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon shifts the Subject role to the hearer ('I've tried') for the majority of the application, only returning the Subject role to God in the final doxological movement.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'trying' and 'holding on'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the subject of 'holding' the believer.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Lord, I've tried,' say 'Lord, you have held me when I could not try.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that 'waiting' is not a work but a state of being carried.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Expand on the Isaiah 40:31 quote to show God as the source of the strength.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The preacher effectively uses the 'abomination' to describe the weight of the world.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (trying) precedes the full declaration of Grace (Christ's coming).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Proclaim Christ's presence first, then the 'waiting' as a fruit of that presence.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful and deeply empathetic to the human condition, but it risks crushing the 'weary' hearer by making their effort the primary engine of endurance.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the 'Lord I've tried' section is a climax; actantially, it is a lapse into moralism.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis focuses on the 1290 days; semiotics focuses on who is acting during those days.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the 'grace' language at the end, the 'engine' of the sermon is the hearer's willpower.

appendices.notities: The sermon reflects the transition from Civil Rights optimism to mid-70s malaise.
